page.title: 14SOCIAL CARE IN AMMANFORD
page.content: The Amman Valley has a growing population and the majority are elderly or very young. Four dentists and seven doctors serve the community. Indeed, there is such a great demand for treatment that a second brand new surgery is to be built in Ammanford shortly. A health clinic has been opened in the old Secondary Modern school, offering ante and post natal classes, baby clinics and family planning advice to the community. An estimated 300 people seek help and advice at the clinic each week. The elderly are also cared for. The area has a home for the aged at Tegfan and two separate sheltered-homes sites in the village of Tirdail, alone. "Cartref" is a day centre for the elderly. A meals on wheals sevice is also run on a volunteer basis.
